content.description:
The Ill-Fated Glory of Marcellus

Heuheu, interj.: oh! alas! pietas, heu priscapriscus, -a, -um, adj. = antiquus, -a, -um fides invictainvictus, -a, -um, adj.: unconqueredque bello
dextera! Non illi1 se quisquam impuneimpune, adv.: unpunished tulisset
obviusobvius, -a, -um, adj. (+ dat.): meeting armatoarmo, -are, -avi, -atum: to arm, seuseu, conj.: whether, or cum pedespedes, -itis, m.: foot soldier iret in hostem
seu spumantisspumo, -are: to froth (at the mouth) equi foderetfodio, -ere: to pierce calcaribuscalcar, -aris, n.: spur armosarmus, -i, m. = latus, -eris.
 1:refers to Marcellus (a descendant of Emperor Augustus)↩
